title: W3.CSSLists

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSSLists with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
× Mike Web Designer × Jill Support × Jane Accountant Basic List The w3-ul class is used to display a basic list: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
Bordered List The w3-border class adds a border around the list: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
List Header An example of how to add a heading element inside the list item: Names Jill Eve Adam Example

  • Names

  • Eve
  • Adam
List as a Card The w3-card- number classes can be used to show a list as a card: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
Centered List The w3-center class can be used to center the list items in a list: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
Colored List The w3- color classes can be used to add a color to the list: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
Colored List Item The w3- color classes can be used to add a color to the list item: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
Hoverable List The w3-hoverable class adds a grey background color to each list item on mouse-over: Jill Eve Adam Example
  • Jill
  • Eve
  • Adam
If you want a specific hover color, add any of the w3-hover- color classes to each
  • element: Jill Eve Adam Example
    • Jill
    • Eve
    • Adam
    Closable List Item Click on the "x" to close/hide a list item: Jill × Adam × Eve × Example
  • Jill ×
    • Tip: The HTML × entity is the preferred icon for close buttons (rather than the letter "X"). List With Padding The w3-padding classes can be used to add padding to list items: Jill Eve Adam Jill Eve Adam Example
    • Jill
    • Eve
    • Adam
    Avatar List × Mike Web Designer × Jill Support × Jane Accountant Example
  • ×
    Mike
    Web Designer
    • Tip: You will learn more about the w3-bar classes in our W3.CSS Bars and W3.CSS Navigation chapters. List Width Lists have a 100% width by default. Use the width property to change this. Example
    • Jill
    • Eve
    • Adam
    30% width: Jill Adam 50% width: Jill Adam 80% width: Jill Adam Tiny List Use the w3-tiny class to display a tiny list: Jill Eve Adam Example

    XLarge List Use the w3-xlarge class to display an extra large list: Jill Eve Adam Example

    XXLarge List Use the w3-xxlarge class to display an XXLarge list: Jill Eve Adam Example
    • Jill
    • Eve
    • Adam
    XXXLarge List Use the w3-xxxlarge class to display an XXXLarge list: Jill Eve Adam Example
    • Jill
    • Eve
    • Adam
    Jumbo List Use the w3-jumbo class to display an enormous "jumbo" list: Jill Eve Adam Example
    • Jill

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSSLists concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSSLists effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSSLists and how to apply it in your projects.
